title: Don't understand imports in 2018 edition.
body:
My code and folder:

```Rust
use utils::random::Random;

mod utils;

fn main() {
    let mut r = Random::new(131231);
}

```
├── [drwxr-xr-x Dec 18 18:09]  utils
│   ├── [-rw-r--r-- Dec 18 18:06]  random.rs
│   └── [-rw-r--r-- Dec 18 18:09]  mod.rs
└── [-rw-r--r-- Dec 18 18:53]  main.rs



```
error[E0658]: imports can only refer to extern crate names passed with `--extern` on stable channel (see issue #53130)
 --> src/main.rs:4:9                                                                     
  |                                                                                      
1 | mod utils;                                                                           
  | ---------- not an extern crate passed with `--extern`                                
...                                                                                      
4 |     use utils::random;                                                               
  |         ^^^^^                                                                        
  |                                                                                      
note: this import refers to the module defined here                                      
 --> src/main.rs:1:1                                                                     
  |                                                                                      
1 | mod utils;                                                                           
  | ^^^^^^^^^^                                                                           
                                                                                         
error: aborting due to previous error                                                    
                                          
```


It works before 2018 edition, and I read other issues, but still don't understand? How to do this import in 2018 edition?
